definitions.definition: Ammunition.
To load up on ammunition.
A utensil for watering plants, consisting of a container with a handle and long spout, the spout sometimes being fitted with a perforated nozzle.

Any of various land-dwelling reptiles, of the family Testudinidae or the order Testudines , whose body is enclosed in a shell (carapace plus plastron). The animal can withdraw its head and four legs partially into the shell, providing some protection from predators.

A Cantonese-style meal traditionally eaten in the morning or early afternoon, comprising tea and food typically placed in small steamer baskets or on small plates and often served from carts that move around from table to table in a restaurant.
The food served at a dim sum meal, typically including dumplings, seafood and desserts.
A tunnel made of polyethylene, used to grow plants that require a higher temperature and/or humidity than that which is available in the environment.
To make calm and content, or regain the goodwill of; to placate.
To mediate in a dispute.
A wind blowing from the north.
Facing the north; directed towards the north.
Located in a northern region
Coming from the north.
In an northward direction or position; (towards the) north.
From the north.
An ecstasy; a trance.
Rapidity.
To transport or ravish.
To carry away by force.
Snatched, taken away; abducted.
Lifted up into the air; transported into heaven.
Very interested, involved in something, absorbed, transfixed; fascinated or engrossed.
definitions.example: 1998, Derel Leebaert, Present at the Creation, Derek Leebaert (editor), The Future of the Electronic Marketplace, page 24,

definitions.definition: Enthusiatic; ecstatic, elated, happy.
definitions.example: He was rapt with his exam results.

definitions.definition: The killing of a king.
One who kills a king.
In a publication and particularly a magazine, the two central pages, which belong to the same paper and face each other: the most visible part.
Any of various asteroids or other echinoderms (not in fact fish) with usually five arms, many of which eat bivalves or corals by everting their stomach.
Any many-armed or tentacled sea invertebrate, whether cnidarian, echinoderm, or cephalopod.
A woman who reluctantly takes part in sexual intercourse, and lays on her back while spreading her limbs.
(usually in translations of Japanese pornography) The anus.
To assume a splayed-out shape, like that of a starfish.
To form into a splayed-out shape, like that of a starfish.
A plant, passiflora, that produces an edible fruit.
The edible fruit of the passionflower, Passiflora edulis; a round fruit with a purple or yellow skin which is native to Brazil.
definitions.example: He brought four passion fruits from the market.

definitions.definition: The flesh of the edible fruit.
definitions.example: A slice of passion fruit was added to the dessert for visual interest.

definitions.definition: A person whom one cherishes very much, especially a woman.
A piece of rubber or similar material with a design or text carved or molded for the purpose of transferring ink or dye to imprint that design on another object.
definitions.example: The library had a rubber stamp to imprint the due date.

definitions.definition: A person or organisation that approves, routinely or as a formality, matters decided by some other person or organisation.
To process, approve or decide matters routinely rather than through careful consideration.
definitions.example: They usually just rubber stamp orders under $100.

definitions.definition: Of a person, organisation, or process, making decisions or approving matters routinely or without real power.
definitions.example: rubber stamp committee

definitions.definition: Finance that is provided to unemployed or low-income people or groups
To sew with long or loose stitches, as for temporary use, or in preparation for gathering the fabric.
A basting; a sprinkling of drippings etc. in cooking.
To sprinkle flour and salt and drip butter or fat on, as on meat in roasting.
(by extension) To coat over something.
To mark (sheep, etc.) with tar.
To beat with a stick; to cudgel.
A building where movies are shown to an audience; a cinema.
A number or expression that another is to be divided by.
definitions.example: In "42 ÷ 3" the divisor is the 3.

definitions.definition: An integer that divides another integer an integral number of times.
definitions.example: The positive divisors of 6 are 1, 2 and 3.

definitions.definition: One entrusted with a (small) commission, such as an errand; especially, an attendant or subordinate employee in a public office, hotel, etc.
A uniformed doorman.
An undisclosed agent under European civil law.
A social and economic class lying above the lower middle class and below the upper class.
(in the plural) the groups in society composed of highly educated professionals and middle managerial level workers.
(grammar) A conditional sentence; a statement that depends on a condition being true or false.
(grammar) The conditional mood.
A statement that one sentence is true if another is.
definitions.example: "A implies B" is a conditional.

definitions.definition: An instruction that branches depending on the truth of a condition at that point.
definitions.example: if and while are conditionals in some programming languages.

definitions.definition: A limitation.
Limited by a condition.
definitions.example: I made my son a conditional promise: I would buy him a bike if he kept his room tidy.

definitions.definition: Stating that one sentence is true if another is.
definitions.example: "A implies B" is a conditional statement.

definitions.definition: (grammar) Expressing a condition or supposition.
definitions.example: a conditional word, mode, or tense

definitions.definition: Of, pertaining to, or consisting of several ethnic groups.
A divorced woman
The broadcasting and receiving of television services via digital (rather than analog) signals, either broadcast, or via cable or satellite.
A television set that is capable of handling such signals.
An opaque, glassy coating baked onto metal or ceramic objects.
A coating that dries to a hard, glossy finish.
The hard covering on the exposed part of a tooth.
A cosmetic intended to give the appearance of a smooth and beautiful complexion.
To coat or decorate with enamel.
To variegate with colours, as if with enamel.
To form a glossy surface like enamel upon.
definitions.example: to enamel card paper; to enamel leather or cloth

definitions.definition: To disguise with cosmetics, as a woman's complexion.
A viscous hydrocarbon secretion of many plants, particularly coniferous trees.
Any of various yellowish viscous liquids or soft solids of plant origin; used in lacquers, varnishes and many other applications; chemically they are mostly hydrocarbons, often polycyclic.
Any synthetic compound of similar properties.
To apply resin to.
To fail to be completed, particularly for lack of interest; to be left out, to suffer from neglect.
Continuous; incessant; without interruption; all day long; nonstop: from the concept that it happens while the hands of the clock go all the way around.
A violation or breach, as of a law.
An encroachment on a right, a person, a territory, or a property.
To invigorate; to make energetic.
To supply with energy, especially electricity; to turn on power to (something).
definitions.example: Whenever we energize that circuit we blow a fuse.

definitions.definition: To use strength in action; to act or operate with force or vigor; to act in producing an effect.
The act of expelling or the state of being expelled.
definitions.example: The scandal involved every member of the high school's football team, resulting in a flurry of expulsions, starting with the quarterback.

definitions.definition: To determine with precision; to mark out with distinctness; to ascertain or exhibit clearly.
definitions.example: the defining power of an optical instrument

definitions.definition: To settle, decide (an argument etc.)
To express the essential nature of something.
definitions.example: I define myself as a techno-anarchist.

definitions.definition: To state the meaning of a word, phrase, sign, or symbol.
definitions.example: The textbook defined speed as velocity divided by time.

definitions.definition: To describe, explain, or make definite and clear; used to request the listener or other person to elaborate or explain more clearly his or her intended meaning of a word or expression.
definitions.example: Person 1: Is she good at math?

definitions.definition: To demark sharply the outlines or limits of an area or concept.
definitions.example: to define the legal boundaries of a property

definitions.definition: To establish the referent of a term or notation.
Serving to define or distinguish.
definitions.example: The ability to reproduce is a defining characteristic of living organisms.

definitions.definition: Pliant, obedient, tractable (to) (i.e. easily moved or bent, morally).
Submissive, humble, meek (as subsense of 4).
Gracious, indulgent, favourable; obliging, amiable, courteous, affable, kindly (as subsense of 1).
With infinitive: Easily moved, prone, ready (as subsense of 1).
Flexible, pliant (arising from sense 1).
Blithe, gladsome, bright, lively, gay (attested after 1).
(of a man or woman) Cheerful, happy (possibly as subsense of 6).
(chiefly of women) Full of health, vigour, and good temper; well-favoured, plump and comely, 'jolly', comfortable-looking (in person). (arising from sense 6).
(of a woman) Having a full, voluptuous figure, especially possessing large breasts (as subsense of 8).
To become sleepy or weary.
To make sleepy or weary.
To become bored or impatient (with).
definitions.example: I tire of this book.

definitions.definition: To bore.
Accoutrements, accessories.
Dress, clothes, attire.
A covering for the head; a headdress.
Metal rim of a wheel, especially that of a railroad locomotive.
The rubber covering on a wheel; a tyre.
A child's apron covering the upper part of the body, and tied with tape or cord; a pinafore. Also tier.
To dress or adorn.
To seize, pull, and tear prey, as a hawk does.
To seize, rend, or tear something as prey; to be fixed upon, or engaged with, anything.
A tier, row, or rank.
The desert in which Christ fasted for 40 days according to the Bible.
A grace period of 40 days during which a widow has the right to remain in her dead husband's home, regardless of the inheritance.
A sanitary measure to prevent the spread of a contagious plague by isolating those believed or feared to be infected.
Such official detention of a ship at or off port due to suspicion that it may be carrying a contagious disease aboard.
A certain place for isolating persons suspected of suffering from a contagious disease.
A certain period of time during which a person is isolated to determine whether they've been infected with a contagious disease.
(by extension) Any rigorous measure of isolation, regardless of the reason.
A record system kept by port health authorities in order to monitor and prevent the spread of contagious diseases.
A place where email messages or other files which are suspected of harboring a computer virus are stored.
To retain in obligatory isolation or separation, as a sanitary measure to prevent the spread of contagious disease.
To put in isolation as if by quarantine
A film stand-in for an actor, in scenes not involving the face, especially during scenes of nudity, or of dangerous activity.
A political decoy; a person employed to impersonate a politician, in order to draw attention away from the real person or to take risks on their behalf.
A closely-cropped male haircut in which the hairs stick upward, like the short bristles of a brush.
An area in a town or city intended for pedestrians only, where vehicles (in particular motor vehicles) are not normally allowed.

A polygraph, a device which measures and records several physiological variables such as blood pressure, heart rate, respiration and skin conductivity while a series of questions is being asked to a subject, in an attempt to detect lies.
Any of various recreational drugs, especially those whose main ingredient is benzylpiperazine.
A distinct flavor, especially if slight.
definitions.example: rice pudding with a smack of cinnamon

definitions.definition: A slight trace of something; a smattering.
Heroin.
A form of fried potato; a scallop.
To get the flavor of.
To indicate or suggest something; used with of.
definitions.example: Her reckless behavior smacks of pride.

definitions.definition: To have a particular taste; used with of.
A small sailing vessel, commonly rigged as a sloop, used chiefly in the coasting and fishing trade and often called a fishing smack
A group of jellyfish.
A sharp blow; a slap. See also: spank.
The sound of a loud kiss.
A quick, sharp noise, as of the lips when suddenly separated, or of a whip.
To slap someone.
To make a smacking sound.
To strike a child (usually on the buttocks) as a form of discipline. (US spank)
To wetly separate the lips, making a noise, after tasting something or in expectation of a treat.
To kiss with a close compression of the lips, so as to make a sound when they separate.
As if with a smack or slap; smartly; sharply.
definitions.example: Right smack bang in the middle.

definitions.definition: The main entrance to a building or house, normally fronts onto a street
The normal portal page to a website.
The path of a pitch which starts inside and then slides over the plate.
definitions.example: His front door slider is hard to handle.

definitions.definition: Vagina, as a means of sexual intercourse, contrasted with the anus or "back door"
A protein on a cell wall that binds with specific molecules so that they can be absorbed into the cell in order to control certain functions.
Any specialized cell or structure that responds to sensory stimuli.
A direct embedding of, or a hyperlink to, a resource on another server, particularly images or video.
A small bundle, as of straw or other like substance; any slender, flexible structure or group.
definitions.example: A wisp of hair escaped her barrette and whipped wildly in the wind.

definitions.definition: A whisk, or small broom.
A will o' the wisp, or ignis fatuus.
An immeasurable, indefinable essence of life; soul.
A disease affecting the feet of cattle.
To brush or dress, as with a wisp.
To rumple.
To produce a wisp, as of smoke.
The upper portion of a page (or other) layout.
definitions.example: If you reduce the header of this document, the body will fit onto a single page.

definitions.definition: Text, or other visual information, used to mark off a quantity of text, often titling or summarizing it.
definitions.example: Your header is too long; "Local Cannibals" will suffice.

definitions.definition: Text, or other visual information, that goes at the top of a column of information in a table.
definitions.example: That column should have the header "payment status".

definitions.definition: A font, text style, or typesetting used for any of the above.
definitions.example: Parts of speech belong in a level-three header. Level-two headers are reserved for the name of the language.

definitions.definition: The first part of a file or record that describes its contents.
definitions.example: The header includes an index, an identifier, and a pointer to the next entry.

definitions.definition: The first part of a packet or stream, often containing its address and descriptors.
definitions.example: The encapsulation layer adds an eight-byte header and a two-byte trailer to each packet.

definitions.definition: A brick that is laid sideways at the top of a wall or within the brickwork with the short side showing.
definitions.example: This wall has four header courses.

definitions.definition: A horizontal structural or finish piece over an opening.
A machine that separates and gathers the heads of grain etc.
definitions.example: They fed the bale into the header.

definitions.definition: The act of hitting the ball with the head.
definitions.example: His header for the goal followed a perfect corner kick.

definitions.definition: Someone who heads the ball.
A headlong fall or jump.
definitions.example: The clown tripped over the other clown and took a header.

definitions.definition: A raised tank that supplies water at constant pressure, especially to a central heating and hot water system.
A pipe which connects several smaller pipes.
definitions.example: Common practice is to use plastic pipes with iron headers.

definitions.definition: The rodeo performer who drives the steer toward the heeler to be tied.
One who puts a head on something.
To strike (a ball) with one's head.
A file, usually in the form of source code, that is automatically included in another source file by the compiler.
A file that contains declarations but no implementations.
To overwhelm with bewilderment; to amaze, confound, or stun, especially in a ludicrous manner.
definitions.example: He was flabbergasted to find that his work had been done for him before he began.

definitions.definition: Appalled, annoyed, exhausted or disgusted.
definitions.example: He was flabbergasted at how much weight he had gained.

definitions.definition: Damned.
To coat with a thin layer of metal by electrochemical means.
To coat with rust-resistant zinc.
definitions.example: to galvanize steel

definitions.definition: To shock or stimulate into sudden activity, as if by electric shock.
definitions.example: Republicans are hoping a proposed gas-tax repeal will galvanize their voters.

definitions.definition: To electrify.
To switch sides between Union and Confederate in the American Civil War.
In the Standard Model, an elementary subatomic particle that forms matter. They combine to form hadrons, such as protons and neutrons.
(X Window System) An integer that uniquely identifies a text string.
A soft creamy cheese, eaten throughout northern, central, and eastern Europe, very similar to cottage cheese except that it is usually not made with rennet.
(Falkland Islands) The black-crowned night heron, Nycticorax nycticorax.
(usually countable) A trout of the species Oncorhynchus mykiss, that has black spots and a pink streak running along the body.
(usually uncountable) The fish as food.
An Indonesian dish of beef (or sometimes other meat) slowly cooked in coconut milk.
Excessively fed; given too much to eat.
To feed a person or animal too much.
To eat more than is necessary.
To beguile or lure (someone) away from duty, accepted principles, or proper conduct; to lead astray.
To entice or induce (someone) to engage in a sexual relationship.
(by extension) To have sexual intercourse with.
definitions.example: He had repeatedly seduced the girl in his car, hotels and his home.

definitions.definition: To win over or attract.
definitions.example: He was seduced by the bright lights and glamour of the city.

definitions.definition: A form of extended deckchair used for sunbathing or relaxing (typically by the sea or a pool)
A dish of pieces of meat, fish, or vegetables roasted on a skewer or spit, especially a doner kebab.
A shish kebab or any other food on a skewer.
The outward growing portions of a shish kebab structure.
A Muslim, usually of southern European, Middle Eastern, or North African descent.
The vulva.
To roast in the style of a kebab
To stab or skewer
An arrangement whereby multiple people are employed on a part-time basis to perform a job normally available to one working full-time, and remuneration is apportioned between them.
A mammal that lays eggs and has a single urogenital and digestive orifice. Only the echidnas and platypuses are included in this group
(of a pollen grain) Having a single trema, or aperture.
The hinged part on the trailing edge of an airplane wing, used to control longitudinal turns.
A half gable, as at the end of a penthouse or of the aisle of a church.
A running race over a distance longer than 42.195 km, the length of a standard marathon.

Law developed by judges, courts, and agency adjudicatory tribunals, through their decisions and opinions (also called case law) (as opposed to statutes promulgated by legislatures, and regulations promulgated by the executive branch).

Legal system mainly in England and its former colonies with a heavy emphasis on judge-made law, doctrines deduced by casuistry rather than from general principles, and law distributed among judicial decisions rather than codified statutes (as opposed to civil law).

Body of law and procedure administered in certain courts (known as law courts) in England and its former colonies characterized by a rigid system of writs, with a limited set of remedies (as opposed to equity or admiralty).
(Scots law, Roman-Dutch law) Law of general application throughout a country, province, or state as opposed to law having only a special or local application
A surgeon specializing in brain surgery.
Either of the large flat bones at the back of the shoulder.
A genre of music that originated in black American gospel, characterized by the use of secular lyrics, and an earthy, intensely emotional style.
A beard trimmed to grow only at the center of the chin.
A procedure for dividing multidigit numbers, breaking down the division into a series of easier steps.
The cost or expense of an airplane ticket or trip.
definitions.example: I'd love to visit Paris, but I can't afford the airfare.

definitions.definition: A female landlord.
An organism whose cell (or cells) are characterized by the absence of a nucleus or any other membrane-bound organelles.
In the two-empire system of biological taxonomy, an organism of the kingdom Prokaryotae (now superseded).
To fear greatly.
To anticipate with fear.
definitions.example: I'm dreading getting the results of the test, as it could decide my whole life.

definitions.definition: To be in dread, or great fear.
To style (the hair) into dreadlocks.
Causing fear, dread or terror.
definitions.example: I have got the dreaded flu.

definitions.definition: Wearing dreadlocks.
A room used for dressing or changing clothes.
Having the characteristics of a tiger
Inflammation of the meninges, characterized by headache, neck stiffness and photophobia and also fever, chills, vomiting and myalgia.
A pad behind the saddle of a horse for a second rider.
A similar second saddle on a motorcycle for a passenger.
The person riding in the pillion.
The cushion of a saddle.
To ride on a pillion.
To put a pillion on a horse.
Riding behind the driving rider, as when positioned on the rump of a mount.
A tree or plant that has been miniaturized by planting it in a small pot, restricting its roots, and by careful pruning.
The art of planting and growing trees or plants in such a manner.
To make into a bonsai by restricting the roots and pruning.
